newsitem.title: FRANCE: PSA seeks 14 pct productivity gain in 97.
newsitem.headline: PSA seeks 14 pct productivity gain in 97.

text.p: PSA Peugeot Citroen chairman Jacques Calvet said on Thursday he was targeting a 14 percent productivity improvement at the factory level in 1997.
"Manufacturing productivity is current making double-digit gains every year, rising by 13 percent in 1996 and 14 percent in 1997," he told a news conference.

"In the future we expect to sharply reduce production costs by around 25 percent by streamlining assembly lines, reducing the number of model versions and designating...platform managers whose mission is to find ways to enhance quality and cut costs throughout a model's lifespan," he said.
